intro: Massonia inexpectata, commonly known as the Cape goldcup, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Massonia inexpectata is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
